instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low
threads.message:
got this random board had a couple knocked off components replaced n retraced i get no green light and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is around 1v, <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> is present.
replaced isl but nothing changed. no green light on charger.

i dont have much hope for this thing i can tell someone may have tried reflowing it before me the black plastic on cpu is warped just wondering if i may be missing something.

if i can get <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> to be present at least also <SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> is the same as <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 1v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low
threads.message: Resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>? If it's low, it's probably shorted because of the fucking moron who reflowed the CPU.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> low
threads.message:
Measure resistance to ground on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
Also measure on all big coils. If you find same value on any, check for short to <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>.
If no short/low value, then post some voltages at <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>.
Start checking resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28.
